byline.contributor: Kara Andrade contributed reporting from Guatemala City, Guatemala.

snippet: More than a half-century after Guatemala’s elected president Jacobo Arbenz Guzman was overthrown in a coup, President Alvaro Colom apologized on Thursday for what he called a “great crime.”

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat

lead_paragraph: More than a half-century after Guatemala’s elected president Jacobo Arbenz Guzman was overthrown in a coup, President Alvaro Colom apologized on Thursday for what he called a “great crime.”

headline.main: An Apology for a Guatemalan Coup, 57 Years Later
headline.print_headline: An Apology for a Guatemalan Coup, 57 Years Later
